question: You are a code expert. Please use your professional knowledge to generate accurate and professional responses. Make sure that the code you generate is executable for display. Please help me create a webpage for an e-commerce site that needs to showcase images and text content. The design preference is for a minimalist European feel, and you can handle the rest as you see fit.

checklist.title: Is the e-commerce product showcase system fully implemented?
checklist.description: Review whether the HTML/CSS/JavaScript implementation includes a responsive product grid, product detail views, and effective image handling techniques. Score 0 if the core product display functionality is missing, 5 if only basic product showcasing is implemented, and 10 if the showcase includes features like image zoom/gallery views, product filtering, and smooth transitions between product views.

checklist.title: Is the minimalist European design aesthetic properly executed?
checklist.description: Evaluate the implementation of minimalist European design principles including ample whitespace, restrained typography (preferably sans-serif), muted color palette (whites, grays, with minimal accent colors), and focus on product presentation rather than decorative elements. Deduct 3 points for each design element that contradicts minimalist European aesthetics (e.g., busy patterns, excessive colors, cluttered layouts). Award full points only if the design achieves elegant simplicity with purposeful negative space.

checklist.title: Is the e-commerce navigation system intuitive and complete?
checklist.description: Check for implementation of essential e-commerce navigation components: primary navigation menu, search functionality, category filters, breadcrumbs, and cart/checkout access. Deduct 2 points for each missing navigation element and 3 points if the navigation is not persistent across the site. Review the mobile navigation adaptation – deduct 5 points if the mobile menu is not properly implemented or accessible.

checklist.title: Is product information architecture effectively structured?
checklist.description: Assess how product information is structured and presented. Check for clear hierarchies between product titles, prices, descriptions, specifications, and availability. Evaluate whether the code implements semantic HTML elements for proper information hierarchy. Deduct 5 points if product cards lack essential information and 5 points if the information architecture doesn't prioritize key purchasing decision factors. Award full points for clean, scannable product information that follows established e-commerce patterns.

checklist.title: Is the code robust?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the code can handle common abnormal situations (such as missing images, slow loading content, invalid product data, etc.) and provide friendly error handling or fallback mechanisms. Code with strong robustness should be able to effectively handle these edge cases, giving 10 points. If the robustness is average, give 5 points, and if no exceptions are handled, give 0 points.

checklist.title: Are there any innovative features that are eye-catching?
checklist.description: Check whether the code includes surprise features that enhance the e-commerce experience (e.g., 1. Subtle micro-animations on hover/interaction 2. Product comparison tool 3. Intelligent product recommendations 4. Elegant image lazy-loading with placeholders). Add 3 points for each practical innovative feature implemented (maximum 10 points).

checklist.title: Are there any redundant features?
checklist.description: Strictly check three types of redundancy: 1. Redundant implementation of similar functions (e.g., multiple carousel libraries coexisting) 2. Function modules unrelated to e-commerce showcase (e.g., unnecessary social media widgets) 3. Fancy effects that affect performance (e.g., excessive animations or heavy background videos). Deduct 3 points for each redundancy found, and directly deduct 10 points if the core functions are interfered with by redundant code.

checklist.title: Does the code have engineering quality?
checklist.description: Review modular design (such as separating component structure/styling/behavior), use of modern front-end practices (CSS organization, JavaScript modules), and performance optimization. Deduct 5 points if global CSS/JS pollution is found; deduct 5 points if the code duplication rate is too high (over 30%); deduct 5 points if no performance optimizations are implemented (image optimization, code splitting, etc.). The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Does the interface vision meet professional design standards?
checklist.description: Evaluate whether the overall design follows modern e-commerce design principles: 1) Harmonious color matching (no more than 3 primary colors) 2) Proper layout spacing (element spacing follows the 8px multiple principle) 3) Professional font system (body font size ≥ 14px, line height over 1.5 times) 4) Consistent product card design. Deduct 3 points for each crowded visual element, 5 points for a glaring color combination, and 5 points for chaotic text-image layout. The full score is 10 points.

checklist.title: Is the responsive design properly implemented?
checklist.description: Judge whether the site functions properly across device sizes (mobile, tablet, desktop): 1) No horizontal scrolling on mobile devices 2) Touch-friendly tap targets (min 44x44px) 3) Appropriate font scaling between devices 4) Efficient use of screen real estate at all breakpoints. Deduct 5 points for unreadable text or unusable elements on mobile, 3 points for layout issues at standard breakpoints, and 5 points for performance issues on mobile devices. The full score is 10 points.
